result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley M Pinkert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Marathon or Portage Counties.

miscConds.notes: Restitution  to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions. Sign any releases necessary for agent.

No Contact with any victims listed in the criminal complaint or their residences. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surchage is imposed. Maintain a stable residence. Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. To report 02/19/2015 by 8pm. May transfer to Marathon or Portage Counties.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if revoked. See Count 1 for additional conditions.
Concurrent with: Count 1

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision - Early
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
for Early Discharge from Probation signed by Judge Lazar 06/29/2018.

Defendant Ashley M Pinkert in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Christina Wood appears in court by telephone.   Case called for hearing to address possible early discharge from probation.  Agent Wood advises that a letter was sent to all victims advising them of the court date and to contact Agent Wood with any questions.  Court finds that the victims were notified properly and have not filed any written response or appeared in court today.  State takes not position of the request.  Agent Wood presents statements to the court and is in agreement with the request for early termination.  Defendant presents statements to the court.  Court places its findings on the record.  Court grants early discharge from probation effective 07/02/2018.
Review hearing on June 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ashley M Pinkert in court.  Jasmine Betancourt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Christina Wood from Marathon County appeared by phone.
Court addressess Agent's request for early discharge from probation. State takes no positions. Agent Wood makes statement. Notice of hearing shall be sent to victims.
  Review hearing scheduled for June 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on June 11, 2018 at 09:30 am. Mailed to Probation Agent Wood.
Review hearing on June 11, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Ashley M Pinkert in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Geraghty makes statements regarding sentencing. Patrick M. (Stepfather) makes statements on behalf of the Defendant. Defendant makes Statements. Court Sentences defendant to the following. 

The Defendant was given the following:

COUNT#1: 

WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  5 YEARS  ***CONCURRENT***    ***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MARATHON COUNTY OR PORTAGE COUNTY***              

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia.
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims listed in Criminal Complaint or their residences. 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
____Maintain stable residence

RESTITUTION:  $3502.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  6 MONTHS - Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Defendant must report on February 19, 2015 by 8:00 pm.***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MARATHON COUNTY OR PORTAGE COUNTY***
 
COUNT#7:

WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  5 YEARS, 1 day credit if revoked.  ***CONCURRENT***    ***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MARATHON COUNTY OR PORTAGE COUNTY***              

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia.
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims listed in Criminal Complaint or their residences. 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
____Maintain stable residence

COSTS:  $268.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant Ashley M Pinkert in court with Attorney David P. Geraghty.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 7 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy (also refers to Dodge County Case #14CF10) and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 7 on amended information.  Counts #2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8 and 9 are dismissed and read-in.  State requests presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Court sets sentencing hearing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Jury trial and jury status hearing dates to remain on the Court's calendar as previously scheduled.
